column4: Does anyone know how to change how firefox handles certain files?  I accidentally set torrent files to always dload to the desktop, but i want the open/save dialog back instead.  i tried managing file-types in content prefs, but it is not there.
Does anyone know if Feisty will stop using a dumb altered version of Firefox and just use the Mozilla version?
cables yet another reason apt-get > aptitude
yes.  the preferences in Ubuntu's altered version are messed up.  Especially managing 'file types.'
I set .torrent files accidentally to "automatically save to desktop everytime" and could not edit it in managing file types.
I used aislyu's script to install the Mozilla version on top of it and it worked fine.
doesn't that script replace your .mozilla directory
wow how impressive that must have been for that script "mv ~/.mozilla ~/.mozilla.backup"
the ubuntu firefox can manage filetypes perfectly, at least mine can
what are the changes that ubuntu does to firefox
I cannot explain why it wouldn't work.  It is a fresh install of Ubuntu.
well perhaps you should see if somebody else had the same problem before making such a generalized statement
